motions.title: Procurement of Technology Equipment
motions.description: Approval of procurement request for all hardware necessary to complete full network refresh for city systems using Cybersecurity ARPA II budget for funding up to $527,708.42.

motions.title: Changes to Position Allocation and Compensation Chart
motions.description: Approval of changes to position allocation and compensation chart to transfer one Detective position to a Patrol Officer position.

motions.title: Text Amendment to Chapter 20 Signs (Second Read)
motions.description: Second read approval of text amendment to Chapter 20 (Signs) with amendment to strike revisions to section 20-35, paragraph 1.

motions.title: Resolution Extending Moratorium on Cannabis Retail Stores
motions.description: Approval of resolution extending moratorium on cannabis retail stores for 180 days with new expiration date of September 14, 2023.

specialEvents.title: Dunwoody Preservation Trust Presentation
specialEvents.description: Presentation by Executive Director Noelle Ross on DPT history, 2022 event highlights, and 2023 plans including unveiling of Dunwoody Diorama at Donaldson-Bannister Farm.

specialEvents.title: Civility Pledge
specialEvents.description: Mayor Deutsch read Civility Pledge into record from Georgia Municipal Association, with resolution to be submitted to GMA.

presentations.title: City Manager's Report
presentations.description: Monthly report from City Manager Eric Linton.

discussionItems.title: Withdrawal of Cases RZ22-02 & SLUP 22-02
discussionItems.description: Applicant withdrew rezoning application and Special Land Use Permit application for RZ22-02 and SLUP 22-02 for 41, 47, and 53 Perimeter Center East.

discussionItems.title: Surplus Obsolete Technology Equipment
discussionItems.description: Request to surplus obsolete technology equipment.

discussionItems.title: Vermack Park Property Master Plan
discussionItems.description: Discussion of Vermack Park Property Master Plan with majority of Council feeling trail should be removed from park plan. Staff asked to confirm sewer and stormwater costs.
discussionItems.presenter: Brent Walker with Council Members Price and Seconder

discussionItems.title: Medical Cannabis Considerations Overview
discussionItems.description: Presentation of considerations for regulating medical cannabis dispensaries. Staff recommends permitted use versus special use, minimum distance requirement of 1 mile from other medical cannabis dispensaries, and language preventing consumption on premises.

discussionItems.title: Local Road Safety Plan
discussionItems.description: Update on development of Local Road Safety Action Plan with $1,200,000 in local funds to fund staff person, drafting of plan, and implementation. Contract recommendation to be presented in March.

discussionItems.title: Womack Road Retaining Wall
discussionItems.description: Presentation of Womack Road retaining wall mosaic proposal with two artists providing three options. Council favored larger 45-foot mosaic option for approximately $60K.

discussionItems.title: Conversion of Contract Positions to City Positions
discussionItems.description: Proposal to convert three contract positions to city positions within Finance Department (accounting team from Jacobs and one permitting employee from The Collaborative) for tighter control and staff retention. Internal Auditor found no wrongdoing by former contract employee.

notes: Finance Director Linda Nabors passed away - Richard Platto appointed as Finance Director
